name: UK Government
title: AI Engineering Lab with Time-Limited Vendor Licenses

classification.classificationRationale: Validated Model 2 (Center of Excellence). The AI Engineering Lab at Government Digital Service provides governance, evaluation, and enablement — classic CoE functions. It evaluates AI tools (Copilot, Gemini, Claude, Amazon Q) through time-limited licenses rather than building products. CAIO Kalbir Sohi from consumer tech (Spotify, Facebook) leads the effort. Structural orientation: the AI Engineering Lab is a distinct unit within GDS, separated from the government departments it serves.

description:
The UK Government appointed Kalbir Sohi as its first Chief AI Officer, overseeing AI teams at the Government Digital Service. The hire from consumer tech (Product Director at Spotify Core Infrastructure, senior roles at Facebook) represents a significant departure from traditional government technology leadership.

Backed by a 2 billion pound AI investment (2026-2030) with up to 137 million pounds for the AI Engineering Lab, the approach is distinctive for its time-limited vendor evaluation model. The Lab launches in early 2026 with time-limited licenses (up to 6 months) for Microsoft Copilot, Gemini, Amazon Q/Kiro, and Claude. The time-limited approach is intentional: it forces evaluation, prevents vendor lock-in, and enables comparison across platforms.

The Lab builds on existing AI deployments: the Ministry of Justice's ChatGPT Enterprise, and Whitehall AI tools 'Humphrey' and 'Consult.' The CoE model enables central evaluation and governance while individual government departments adapt AI to their specific domains.
